title: Anthony Rizzo to Cubs fans: 'We'll be back'
text:
Cubs fans are still trying to get over the sting of a season-ending 8-3 defeat to the Mets in Game 4 of the NLCS last night, but this might cheer them up.
Star first baseman Anthony Rizzo tweeted this message Thursday morning:
I couldn't be prouder of my team and all of our accomplishments this year…don't worry we'll be back
— Anthony Rizzo (@ARizzo44) October 22, 2015
The Cubs have made back-to-back postseason appearances just once since 1908, but with loads of young talent, they seem poised to be NL contenders for years to come.
Are the Cubs on the verge of a dynasty? Look at the bright side, Cubs fans. Spring training is just four months away. You’ve waited 107 years for a championship, what’s one more?
Check out the best 24 photos from the Cubs’ postseason run: Start Slideshow » Anthony Rizzo has a message for Cubs fan.
Anthony Rizzo #44 of the Chicago Cubs catches a foul ball hit by Travis d'Arnaud #7 of the New York Mets to end the sixth inning during Game 2 of the 2015 MLB National League Championship Series at Citi Field on October 18, 2015 in the Flushing neighborhood of the Queens borough of New York City. (Photo by Al Bello/Getty Images)
Jake Arrieta #49 of the Chicago Cubs reacts after defeating the Pittsburgh Pirates to win the National League Wild Card game at PNC Park on October 7, 2015 in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. The Chicago Cubs defeated the Pittsburgh Pirates with a score of 4 to 0. (Photo by Jared Wickerham/Getty Images)
